alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 1:45AM CDT until August 04 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL MONROE AND CENTRAL SAINT CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS AND NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI... At 145 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported multiple water rescues on Highway 141 between Highway 21 and Valley Park. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Belleville, Arnold, Waterloo, Columbia, Sunset Hills, Freeburg, Dupo, Fenton, Millstadt, Oakville, Lemay, Mehlville, Barnhart, Antonia, Smithton, Green Park, New Athens, Valmeyer, East Carondelet and New Design. This includes the following State Parks... Mastodon Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
